page.title: 02Attitudes in East Cornwall
page.content: The following remarks were made by people in Chilsworthy and Latchley: "Little attention is paid to the requirements of the{youth}in the area. They need more activities to take up their spare time especially as employment is hard to find at this time. A{village hall}is needed for the Women's Institute, clubs and other local activities. The villages need{public toilet {facilities.}There is only one bus to Tavistock each week and some people do not have a car.The{road surfaces}could also be improved. Many people are annoyed about the low flying{R.A.F. {aircraft}from{stations}in the{South {West}practising manoeuvres. The natives, on the whole, do not agree with the{new style of houses}being built. They spoil the rural scene and bring more outsiders in."
